items.prompt: What is a 'touchpoint' in a customer journey?
options: A physical button on a machine
Any interaction between a customer and the business
items.explanation: Touchpoints include emails, calls, website visits, and in-person interactions.

items.prompt: Choose the correct Future Perfect sentence:
options: By Friday, we will be finishing the audit.
By Friday, we will have finished the audit.
By Friday, we finish the audit.
By Friday, we will finishing the audit.
items.explanation: Future Perfect (will have + past participle) describes a completed action in the future.

items.prompt: What does a high 'churn rate' indicate?
options: Many customers are leaving the company
The company is making a lot of profit
items.explanation: Churn rate measures the loss of customers.

items.prompt: Complete the Future Continuous sentence: 'Don't call me at 2 PM; I ____ a CRM demo for the board.'
items.explanation: Future Continuous is used for actions that will be in progress at a specific time.

items.prompt: What is 'omnichannel' support?
options: Seamless support across multiple communication channels
Support provided by a single person
items.explanation: Omnichannel means integrating various channels (email, social media, chat) for a consistent experience.

items.prompt: By next month, the CRM team ____ all the duplicate records.
items.explanation: Future Perfect is used for an action that will be completed by a certain point in time.

items.prompt: What does 'NPS' stand for in customer experience metrics?
items.explanation: NPS is a metric used to gauge customer loyalty and satisfaction.

items.prompt: This time next week, we ____ the new personalisation strategy.
items.explanation: Future Continuous is used for actions that will be in progress at a specific future time.

items.prompt: In CRM, what is 'data hygiene'?
options: The process of ensuring customer data is accurate and up-to-date
Moving data to a cloud storage
items.explanation: Data hygiene is about maintaining the quality and accuracy of the database.

items.prompt: By the end of the year, I ____ as a CX manager for five years.
items.explanation: Future Perfect Continuous emphasizes the duration of an action up to a point in the future.

items.prompt: What is 'customer journey mapping'?
options: A GPS for tracking customer locations
A visual representation of the customer's experience with the brand
A map of the company's headquarters
A list of all customer addresses
items.explanation: Journey mapping helps visualize the steps a customer takes when interacting with a company.

items.prompt: What is 'service recovery'?
options: Getting a server back online after a crash
Turning a negative customer experience into a positive one after a failure
Increasing the price of a service
items.explanation: Service recovery is the process of resolving a customer's problem and restoring their trust.

items.prompt: Which of these is a 'promoter' in the NPS system?
items.explanation: Promoters (9-10) are loyal enthusiasts who will keep buying and refer others.

items.prompt: Identify the error: 'By next week, we will have been finalized the CRM migration.'
items.explanation: It should be 'will have finalized' (Future Perfect) or 'will have been finalizing' (if continuous).

items.prompt: What is 'customer segmentation'?
options: Dividing a database into groups with similar characteristics
items.explanation: Segmentation allows for more targeted and personalized customer experiences.

items.prompt: I can't meet you at 4 PM tomorrow because I ____ with a client.
items.explanation: Future Continuous is used for scheduled future actions.

items.prompt: What is 'personalisation' in CX?
options: Putting the customer's name on a cup
Using data to tailor experiences to individual needs
items.explanation: Personalisation uses data to make the experience relevant to the specific individual.

items.prompt: By tomorrow morning, the automated system ____ the feedback survey.
items.explanation: Future Perfect is used for an action completed before a specific future time.

items.prompt: What is a 'pain point' in CX?
options: A physical injury sustained at work
A specific problem that customers experience during their journey
The highest price a customer is willing to pay
The end of the working day
items.explanation: Pain points are friction points that cause frustration for customers.

items.prompt: Which tense is used for an action that will be finished *before* a certain time in the future?
items.explanation: The Future Perfect (will have + past participle) expresses 'completion'.
